citations.narrative:
Several areas in the facility had an excessive accumulation of trash and debris. Old, dried-up produce was observed in
the animal keeper areas outside the animal enclosures. Debris, such as bottles and paper, was observed in the fridge
used to store produce fed to the animals.
Trash and debris can attract pests and negatively impact the health and well-being of animals. Premises must be kept
clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate prescribed husbandry practices.
To be corrected by: June 21, 2024.

Numerous live insects (too numerous to count) were observed in the animal keeper area adjacent to the enclosures
housing two bears. Additionally, a trap for flying insects was covered in dead insects to such an extent that it was
ineffective. There was a buildup of cobwebs on the upper part of the animal enclosures and ceilings.
Pests can harbor disease that negatively impacts the health and well-being of animals, as well as cause distress. A safe
and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be established and
maintained.
To be corrected by: June 21. 2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
REBECCA NANNEY, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER
Michael Brooks, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n

narrative:
3.131(c) 
   
Sanitation. 
Several areas in the facility had an excessive accumulation of trash and debris. Old, dried-up produce was observed in 
the animal keeper areas outside the animal enclosures. Debris, such as bottles and paper, was observed in the fridge 
used to store produce fed to the animals.  
 
Trash and debris can attract pests and negatively impact the health and well-being of animals. Premises must be kept 
clean and in good repair to protect the animals from injury and to facilitate prescribed husbandry practices.  
 
To be corrected by: June 21, 2024. 
3.131(d) 
   
Sanitation. 
Numerous live insects (too numerous to count) were observed in the animal keeper area adjacent to the enclosures 
housing two bears. Additionally, a trap for flying insects was covered in dead insects to such an extent that it was 
ineffective. There was a buildup of cobwebs on the upper part of the animal enclosures and ceilings.  
 
Pests can harbor disease that negatively impacts the health and well-being of animals, as well as cause distress. A safe 
and effective program for the control of insects, ectoparasites, and avian and mammalian pests shall be established and 
maintained.  
 
To be corrected by: June 21. 2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representative.

Additional Inspectors: 
REBECCA NANNEY, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER 
Michael Brooks, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
